de.polygonal.ds.pooling.ObjectPool

type
class
A fixed size object pool using an in-place array.
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2008/06/18/using-object-pools/.

Constructor

new(x : Int)
Creates an object pool capable of managing x pre-allocated objects.
Use allocate() to fill the pool.

Instance Methods

allocate(?C : Class<T>, ?fabricate : Void -> T, ?factory : Factory<T>) : Void

parameters
C Allocates objects by creating instances of C.
fabricate Allocates objects by calling fabricate().
factory Allocates objects by calling factory.create().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid arguments (if debug flag is set).
Allocates the pool with x objects. Objects can be allocated by providing a class, a 'factory method' or a 'class factory'.

free() : Void

Nullifies references so all used resources can be garbage collected.

get(id : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid id or object linked to id is not used (call next() first).
Returns the object that is mapped to id. Call next() to receive an id first.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all objects in the pool, regardless if an object is used or not.

next() : Int

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Pool is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the id of the next available object in the pool. After an id has been obtained, the corresponding object can be retrieved using get(id).

put(id : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Pool is full or object linked to id is not used (if debug flag is set).
Recycles the object mapped to id so it can be used in another context.

size() : Int

The total number of pre-allocated objects in the pool.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
